attributes.action: ensure that the mens' and womens' football leagues are managed equitably.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Sunderland Womens Football Club have reportedly been excluded from next season's eight team Premier League on commercial and marketing grounds.

The Guardian quotes Chairman of Sunderland WFC, Maurice Alderson, who has been told of the decision, which he describes as a “kick in the teeth”.

The Club is presently leading the Womens Premier League, includes 9 internationals amongst its players, and has the support of Sunderland AFC.

It is inconceivable that a similar exclusion of a leading team from the mens Premier League would be allowed. To treat the womens game in this way is bad for all football.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
